abstracts.cdata!:
The Infrastructure, Water and
            Environment Project will improve the infrastructure, and
            institutional management of urban water supply and transport
            in Comoros. Nonetheless, it is expected that environmental
            adversity will occur as a result of project implementation,
            namely due to construction, and rehabilitation works.
            Mitigating measures are: 1) Establishment of waste disposal
            sites, and retention schemes to drain water flows, under
            strict bacteriological quality testing of waters, to protect
            aquatic marine bio-diversity. Sewers should be covered, to
            facilitate road functionality. 2) Hydro-biological studies
            should address watershed management, particularly regarding
            water supply distribution; and, regarding the construction
            of water supply systems, protection walls should be built to
            avoid contamination, in addition to including precautionary
            clauses in the bidding documents. Engineering design will
            limit deforestation, and loss of agricultural land. However,
            potential agricultural losses include compensation, or
            resettlement to new lands of equal agricultural value,
            including new seedlings for lost fruits, and vegetables,
            accompanied by compensation for the length of time those
            seedlings remain unproductive. 3) Roads, and infrastructure
            works will require limited working hours, to abate noise and
            air pollution, including spraying to avoid dust pollution.
            Safety measures include road signaling, and an awareness
            campaign to inform the communities.
